title: xdg_data_home changed in v2022.08.03

labels.name: status:in-progress

body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
`Build info                               git_branch=HEAD git_tag=v2022.08.03-dirty git_commit=defbddf8d64718c71ec24c408f31c7f28ecf3e9e`

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
```
$ cat /etc/debian_version 
11.4
$ uname -a
Linux erigon-2 5.10.0-17-cloud-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 5.10.136-1 (2022-08-13) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```


Commit hash : 

#### Expected behaviour
The database location `xdg_data_home` should be preserved on every version upgrade

#### Actual behaviour
In `v2022.08.03`, the existing `xdg_data_home` is not used for our `goerli` node and the `xdg_data_home` has opted out the `goerli` in the path, therefore wrongly detecting that our `goerli` node is new and resync again

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. Upgrade from `v2022.08.02` to `v2022.08.03` on our goerli node
2. Start the docker container
3. Review the log output

````
[backtrace]
````

I would recommend using the flag --datadir (which can be passed via env when running with docker compose, or as a flag elsewhere). 

I'll do a quick diff between the releases and see if I can see why this behaviour has changed.

In our docker environment `XDG_DATA_HOME` is defined as `/home/erigon/.local/share`. I believe the full path to chaindata (i.e. `$XDG_DATA_HOME/erigon/goerli/chaindata` for **goerli**; `$XDG_DATA_HOME/erigon/chaindata` for **mainnet**) will be part of the application logic.

The value of `datadir` does not matter if the sub-directory `erigon/.../chaindata` will be appended in the same way as `XDG_DATA_HOME` above.
@gitmewai this behaviour was changed here: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/5137 with the reasoning linked from the PR.

In order words, for the testnet like `ropsten` and `goerli`, do they take the same default value of `datadir` as in `mainnet` (i.e. `--datadir=/home/erigon/.local/share/erigon` as found in `docker-compose.yml`), and the testnet name will not be part of the full path in `datadir`? Thanks

I believe this is correct, so setting the env var differently per network
would be required to run multiple networks, without having host mount
datadir conflict.
